# Question

Write a function `timezone_bumper(dt,bump)` that increases any provided timestamp by `bump::Int` hours (defaults to +3 hours). Make sure it works only for DateTime types and throws an error for Date types.

Here is the Julia code for your problem:

```julia
using Dates

function timezone_bumper(dt::DateTime; bump=3)
    if typeof(dt) == Date
        throw(ArgumentError("Only DateTime type is allowed"))
    else
        return dt + Hour(bump)
    end
end
```
This function takes a DateTime as input and increases it by the specified amount of hours (defaults to 3). If you provide a Date instead, an error will be thrown.
